column5: This guy is my new hero  http://www.ebaumsworld.com/video/watch/82484792/
<embed src="http://www.ebaumsworld.com/player.swf" allowScriptAccess="always" flashvars="id1=82484792" wmode="opaque" width="567" height="345" allowfullscreen="true"/>
Ya, but did he lose his lip grippers, looks like they went in with him    Very cool
Translation;  blue shirt: This is the best day of my life, praise the Lord.    peacock bass: LOL see ya guys.    green shirt: Not today you son of a bltch.
I should have done that with the Muskey I lost boat side on Sparrow a few years back!
Now thats a good fishing partner to have!
do you think they released it (again) after that?
nah, looks he dropped them in the boat seconds before he made like Phelps.  guy earned his tip if he was the guide
Try doing that with a perch, I did
Zero hesitation -- that was pretty amazing.  But yeah....why not a net?
He was just doing what any good guide would do when you just lost your client's trophy

Ha, can't say I've done that for a fish but a few years back my son and I were fishn in pittock puddle and he dropped his pole in the drink. So in I went, bout 10or 12 ft down,took a couple of dives but I found it. Cleaned her all up an still in use today.

I had a muskie on up at the French a few years back and the hook popped out beside the boat. I just slowly reached down and grabbed it by the gill plate and lifted it out of the water. Don't think it even knew what was going on, it was a quick fight. I wouldn't have jumped in after it though, I had a run in with muskie teeth in the past and it wasn't pretty.
